flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1200>>1200
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=3100>>3100
He wants to put half of $3100 into a retirement account so he will invest 3100/2= $<<3100/2=1550>>1550 into his retirement account
He had 3100 and puts $1550 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 3100-1550 = $<<3100-1550=1550>>1550 remaining
#### 1550

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1300, not 3100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
